title: Usage

## Quickstart

1. Configure `params.yaml` in the repository root (see `/params.yaml` for an example).
2. Make sure databases are downloaded and mounted (see README and `params.yaml` `databases` path).
3. Run the pipeline inside the Docker container or your local environment.

Example (inside the Docker container):

```bash
conda activate postgwas_py39
nextflow run . -profile local -params-file params.yaml
```

### Profiles

Use Nextflow profiles defined in `nextflow.config`: `local`, `hpc`, `standard`, and `test`.

### Common run scenarios

- Run only PREP and LOCI discovery (fast):

```bash
nextflow run . -profile local -params-file params.yaml --run_loci true --run_ld false
```

- Run full pipeline (example):

```bash
nextflow run . -profile local -params-file params.yaml
```

### Outputs

Results are written to the directory specified by `params.output_path` (default: `/nf-postgwas/results`). Sub-folders include:

- `GWAS_Preprocessing`
- `Loci_Preprocessing`
- `LD_Annotation`
- `Fine-mapping`
- `MAGMA`
- `Prioritisation` (gene-level prioritisation outputs)
